meta.description: Learn about AL KINDI - A legal professional specializing in capital markets, M&A, bankruptcy, and crypto regulations. Discover my background, expertise, and professional journey.

introduction.description: I'm a law graduate with a passion for writing and sharing knowledge. I focus on exploring and analyzing legal topics such as capital markets & securities, mergers and acquisitions (M&A), bankruptcy & insolvency, and the legal aspects of crypto assets in Indonesia.

career.current: Currently I'm looking for a job as
career.goal: so I can gain more experience in the field of law especially in the field of corporate & business law.

background.blockchain: Since 2018, I have been deeply immersed in studying blockchain technology, which has given me a unique perspective on the legal and compliance issues surrounding decentralized systems. I actively engage in projects related to crypto regulations and blockchain governance, helping to bridge the gap between legal practice and technological innovation.

blog.purpose: This blog is a platform where I bring together my expertise in law and technology to share knowledge for people who are interested in capital markets, M&A, bankruptcy, and crypto asset regulations.

experiences.title: Experiences
experiences.subtitle: Some experiences I've had in the past few years

trainee.title: Trainee Associate
trainee.description: Assisting in legal research, document drafting, and case analysis for various corporate and commercial matters.

achievements.first: Assisted in drafting and filing various legal documents, including lawsuits, warnings, and contracts, while ensuring compliance with applicable court procedures and legal standards
achievements.second: Conducted in-depth legal research and case analysis to support court submissions and legal opinions, utilizing legal databases and academic resources
achievements.third: Collaborated with senior associates in case strategy meetings, contributing to the preparation of legal arguments and solutions tailored to clients' needs

intern.title: Legal Intern
intern.company: Ariyanto & Rekan, Wahyu Priyanka & Partners, Erlan Nopri & Partners
intern.description: Completed a one-month internship at three law firms simultaneously, gaining comprehensive experience in various aspects of legal practice.

achievements.first: Gained insights and experience in legal drafting and research
achievements.second: Assisted in the management and establishment of a law firm
achievements.third: Learning how to prepare legal opinions for clients

freelancer.title: Freelancer

glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.subtitle: Legal Terms
glossary.description: Collection of legal terms used in Indonesia.

meta.description: Explore a comprehensive collection of legal terms commonly used in Indonesian legal practice.

pt.title: Limited Liability Company (PT)
pt.definition: A legal entity that is a capital partnership, established based on an agreement between 2 or more people and conducts business activities with authorized capital that is entirely divided into shares

tbk.title: Public Company (Tbk)
tbk.definition: A legal entity that has conducted an IPO so that its shares can be bought and owned by the public

bumn.title: State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN)
bumn.definition: A company whose shares are mostly or entirely owned by the State, and all profits are considered as State income, as well as losses which are considered as State losses

perjan.title: Public Service Company (Perjan)
perjan.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the field of public service provision and its business activities do not prioritize profit

perum.title: Public Corporation (Perum)
perum.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the field of public benefit services

persero.title: State-Owned Corporation (Persero)
persero.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the private and cooperative sectors and is prioritized in business activities to gain profit

rups.title: General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS)
rups.definition: One of the company's organs that has the highest authority in a company, consisting of Regular (Annual) GMS and Extraordinary GMS

merger.title: Merger
merger.definition: A legal action taken by one or more companies to merge with another existing company, resulting in the merging company being dissolved
merger.example: The merger between Gojek and Tokopedia in 2021 forming GoTo Group. In this process, both companies combined their operations, assets, and organizational structures into a new entity.
